Prisca is a visiting PhD student affiliated with the Ifakara Health Institute, Tanzania. Her research explores how mosquitoes respond to different insecticide-treated bed nets, including Interceptor G1, Interceptor G2, and chlorfenapyr-only formulations. Using RNA-seq data, she aims to identify genes involved in insecticide resistance for targeted CRISPRâ€“Cas modification and RNAi validation. Her work contributes to understanding mosquito resistance mechanisms and advancing more effective malaria control strategies.
